thread.title: Nkandla saga draws to rowdy close in National Assembly | National
thread.title_full: Nkandla saga draws to rowdy close in National Assembly | National | BDlive

author: Wyndham Hartley
title: Nkandla saga draws to rowdy close in National Assembly | National
text:
Nkandla. Picture: SUNDAY TIMES Related articles Bad press on scandals pulling us down, says ANC Zuma ‘dodges’ Nkandla bullet Nkandla report set for National Assembly In this article Topics: Nkandla People: Jacob Zuma THE more than two-year saga in Parliament over the R246m spent at President Jacob Zuma’s private home in Nkandla came to a rowdy conclusion in the National Assembly on Tuesday.
Three special ad hoc committees have over the years considered the matter of Nkandla and whether Mr Zuma has to repay any of the money as ordered by Public Protector Thuli Madonsela.
The full National Assembly voted to accept Police Minister Nathi Nhleko’s report, which absolves Mr Zuma of repaying any money, in a direct contradiction of Ms Madonsela’s ordered remedial action.
The Economic Freedom Fighters tried to have the matter thrown out on the grounds that it was before the Constitutional Court, while the DA proposed a counter motion that would have supported Ms Madonsela.
Both parties were resoundingly defeated on the floor of the house.
